intro: Sasamorpha borealis var. viridescens, commonly known as the northern sasamorpha, is a rare variant of the sasamorpha plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green, with a subtle bluish tint on the underside. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers during the late spring to early summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate species requiring careful conservation efforts.
